summary: REQ-10 is implemented in backend/main.mo by adding `role : Text` to `Player` and initializing it to `""` in both `createRoom` and `joinRoom`. However, the diff does not show any frontend type/binding updates required by REQ-11. The diff also introduces a migration module and enables actor migration, which were not requested and go beyond simply adding the field.

missing_requirements.requirement: Update generated frontend/backend type bindings (as needed) so the frontend compiles with the updated `Player` type that now includes the `role` field, without introducing any new UI behavior or user-facing text.
missing_requirements.reason: No frontend or generated binding/type files are included in the diff summary; only backend/main.mo, backend/migration.mo, and project_state.json are shown, so there is no evidence that TypeScript bindings/types were regenerated or updated.
evidence: <file-diff>: no frontend or generated binding/type files modified (only backend/main.mo, backend/migration.mo, project_state.json)

hallucinated_features.description: Added a Motoko data migration module and enabled actor state migration (pre/post-upgrade style) to backfill `role = ""` for existing players.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest only asks to add a `role` field with empty-string default for newly created/joined players and to update frontend bindings; it does not request introducing migration logic or new backend upgrade behavior.
